txt.en: 'Fires! Quickly, put them out before they spread!'
Deinol
Lhion
Gludur

'You fought with honour. I do not have much time left. Take my horse and ride away. Tell any who will listen of Saruman's treachery.\n\n'Do not let the end of the Avanc-lûth be for naught. Be well....'

'We have little time. The enemy is too great. We broke into this courtyard, but I fear the nest is truly stirred now.

'We must hold out as long as we can. It has been an honour knowing you, [placeholder]. May your name be heard in the songs of legends.

'Brace yourselves for the final attack.'

'This horde is greater than we could have possibly imagined. We have defeated the forces holding the beach, but more will arrive soon.\n\n'We are too small a force to do much against such a massive army. Let us talk to the Elder.'

'We will take the main force up the river-bank and attack the gates. You must fight through the chaos and destroy as much as you can.

'We are few against an entire army, but we must do all we can. Probably most of us will not survive. Do your part for the good of Dunland.

'Take four of my best warriors to help you. Some of them will help in healing, some will help protect you, and some will attack from a distance. Go now!'

'We have been holding the line for as long as we can. If the Elders want us to attack, then we will! We will head to the right... you must go straight ahead and destroy those siege-engines.\n\n'Wait for our assault; otherwise, there will be too many guards for you to handle.'
Choose four warriors to assist you
Wait for the Dunlendings to move out
Destroying the siege-engine has caused the camp to catch fire
The fire in the camp is spreading all around you
The fire is raging everywhere now
Sounds of a massive battle reach your ears
You have made it out of Wulf's Cleft alive
The Boar-clan is assaulting Wulf's Cleft in an effort to hinder the army there.
Elder Dein has been defeated!
'Wait for our forces to move!'
Brunach
Seren
Iowan
Defeat Dunlending siege-captain
Talk to Elder Déin
Flee on Elder Déin's horse
Don't let Elder Dein be defeated
Talk to Tecwin
Talk to Elder Déin
Choose 4 soldiers to assist you
Talk to Gwin
Destroy the first siege-engine
'Men and women, we march now!'
Destroy the next siege-engine further in the camp
'We must hold off the main force until [placeholder] can destroy the siege-engines!'
'What are we to do, Elder? The force here is much larger than we had anticipated. Should we not just leave?'
Destroy the next set of siege-engines
'Fight for the Boar-clan, fight for the Avanc-lûth... fight for Dunland!'
'We are too few, and they are too many. Our only hope is to strike a blow so that they can not stand with Isengard.'
Destroy the final siege-engines
'But we are Boar-clan. There is no retreat. We must do what we can!'
Talk to Elder Déin quickly
'[placeholder], pick my best four warriors here. The rest of us will create a diversion like no other.'
Shon
Usult
Kenneric
Tecwin kneels before you. Speak with him to discuss his plans.
Speak with Elder Déin as he addresses the warriors.
Elder Déin has asked you to choose four of his finest soldiers to join you in your attempt to destroy the siege engines of the Dunlending army.
Speak with Gwin at the front lines. The Boar-clan will move out and attack the main camp, while you destroy as much of the camp as possible.
Destroy any siege-engines that you come across in the camp.
Destroy any siege-engines that you come across in the camp.
Destroy any siege-engines that you come across in the camp.
Destroy any siege-engines that you come across in the camp.
Speak with Elder Déin in the centre of the conflagration.
Defeat the Dunlending siege-captain quickly.
Merdhin
Speak with Elder Déin again.
Flee upon Elder Déin's horse before the chance to survive is no more!
Gwennel
Hulwen
Instance: Tusks of the Boar
